title: Highest Energy Consumption Per Capita
description: In 2022, Qatar had the highest energy consumption per capita globally, with 16,683.66 kg of oil equivalent per person.

title: Full Internet Accessibility for Males
description: By 2020, 100% of the male population in Qatar had access to the internet, showcasing complete digital connectivity.

title: Leading in Gross Savings
description: In 2022, Qatar's gross savings accounted for 67.63% of its GDP, one of the highest globally, indicating strong economic reserves.

title: Top GNI Per Capita
description: Qatar's GNI per capita reached $125,240 in 2023, positioning it as one of the wealthiest nations per capita worldwide.

title: High Gender Parity in Tertiary Education
description: In 2022, Qatar achieved a gender parity index of 1.79 in tertiary education, reflecting significant female participation.

title: High Male Employment Rate
description: By 2024, 95.52% of males aged 15 and above were employed in Qatar, indicating a robust job market for men.

title: Predominantly Male Population
description: In 2023, males constituted 71.52% of Qatar's total population, highlighting a significant gender imbalance.

title: Significant Tourism Expenditure
description: In 2020, international tourism expenditures made up 19.48% of Qatar's total imports, emphasizing the sector's economic impact.

title: Lowest Household Consumption Expenditure
description: In 2022, household and NPISHs final consumption expenditure in Qatar was only 19.5% of GDP, indicating a low level of domestic consumption compared to global standards.

title: Minimal Forest Depletion
description: Qatar reported a net forest depletion of virtually 0% of GNI in 2021, showcasing its minimal impact on forest resources.

title: Negligible Forest Rents Contribution
description: In 2021, forest rents contributed a mere 0.00007% to Qatar's GDP, reflecting the country's limited reliance on forest resources for economic output.

title: Low Mortality from Unsafe Water and Sanitation
description: Qatar had a mortality rate of 0.4 per 100,000 population due to unsafe water and sanitation in 2019, indicating effective public health measures.

title: Minimal Female Employment in Agriculture
description: In 2023, only 1.5% of female employment in Qatar was in agriculture, highlighting a shift towards other sectors.

title: Low Youth Male Unemployment
description: Youth male unemployment in Qatar was just 0.25% in 2022, showcasing strong employment opportunities for young men.

title: Low Crude Death Rate
description: Qatar's crude death rate was 0.93 per 1,000 people in 2023, reflecting a healthy population with low mortality rates.

title: High Urbanization
description: With only 0.65% of the population living in rural areas in 2023, Qatar is one of the most urbanized countries globally.

title: Low Age Dependency Ratio
description: In 2023, Qatar had an age dependency ratio of 20.1%, indicating a relatively low burden on the working-age population.

title: Low Female Population Percentage
description: Females made up only 28.5% of Qatar's total population in 2023, highlighting a significant gender imbalance.
